Reviews.Title: “Overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: BrusselStardancer
Reviews.Content: The title may surprise some travelers as 210 € a night seems normal for a 4 star in Paris. Well except for the banner on the wall, it is not a four star. Let's say a 3. The reception makes you feel as you were in a 'near to the railway station' hotel although everything' s clean and the personnel is helpful. The scary elevator brings you to your floor where you reach your room through a very small aisle. The (superior) room as such is very small but ok. In the morning you can take your breakfast in the basement. If you want to go to Paris, you have better choices for your money.

Reviews.Title: “good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Anatmo54
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. The room was nice and clean and the staff very helpful. They spoke English and spanish and even russian.

Reviews.Title: “A nice 3* hotel all in all”
Reviews.Author: AnastasijaA2
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in May, we went for a short trip in Paris with my boyfriend...and from the beginning, when I saw this hotel outside I was a little bit scared, the same feeling was following me when I saw the reception, but the rooms were really beautiful, clean, modern...everything you would wish for a romantic trip in Paris. The view on the balconies of the beautiful parisien architecture...just magic. The breakfast was a little bit disappointing, because I always had good experiences in Paris with food...but not this time. There was not a lot of choice, the staff...well...there were no waitresses at all! So you couldn't order anything. Another minus for this hotel is definitely the position...let's say 15minutes from the metro, so after walking all the day along Paris...you almost die until coming to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for Paris, despite what other reviewers may have said”
Reviews.Author: hilandwil
Reviews.Content: I reserved this hotel through Hotwire and was worried after I found out the name of the hotel and read other guests' comments. However, once we got to the hotel and checked in, I can say that there was nothing to worry about. The size of the hotel room (#03) was certainly acceptable, and the decoration was recent and nice. We had necessary amenities in the room, including a flat-screen television, coffee/tea making necessities, a mini bar and a fully equipped bathroom. Of course, this hotel is in Paris, and the size of the room has to be judged accordingly. The "down" side was the hotel's distance from the nearest metro station (10 minute walk to "Rome"), but the stop for bus line 53 is a 2 minute walk. We did not try the 15 euro breakfast and chose to go to a brasserie nearby instead.

Reviews.Title: “Hotwire Customers Beware - Not a 4 Star Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: FreqBizTraveller68
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Hotwire. It was listed (without being named) as a 4-star hotel. It is not a 4 star hotel. The sign on the front door and the hotel's own literature (not to mention the quality of the place) is not 4 star. I have stayed at numerous hotels all over Paris and this is a good 3 star hotel AT BEST. If you are a Hotwire customer, they only give you the smallest rooms in the "04" series which face into a outdoor shaft meaning that the room is very dark. The bathrooms are new and the rest of the room fairly decent, although very dated, but not worthy of a a 4-star rating in any city.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad experience”
Reviews.Author: RAJ2008
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 21 and we stayed in 21 rooms from the 8th to the 10th of July 2011. On the 9th evening after we returned from dinner, one of my friends' Bag was broken open and a Blackberry Mobile was stolen. On complaining to the Management, they showed their helplessness, and informed us that the cleaning of Rooms were outsourced hence the Management could not be made responsible. This is utter nonsense.... Not expected from a Best Western group Hotel. I will not recommend any Best Western group Hotel to anyone anywhere.....

Reviews.Title: “Small is nice”
Reviews.Author: Frjan
Reviews.Content: Small, renovated and clean hotel, good brekfast, nice people at reception desk.

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings....”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Rooms were booked in Nov. 2010 and we discovered that in January 2011 they changed ownership, without notifying us. A lengthy discusion had to be made in order to come to agreement on the arrangements made in November. Yet no free bottled water and other small perks, initially included in the deal, were supplied. Disappointing was also the fact that reception staff (except the friendly lady from Kenya) did not bother to get to know and recognize their guests!

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ateeshnarang
Reviews.Content: Really good hotel, real place to stay, walking distance to Effil tower, memorable visit to Paris, Hotel services were awesome….. wld lik to visit & stay there again......;)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Housekeeping, budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: tobes303
Reviews.Content: I arrived from Charle De Gaulle Airport at 6:45 A.M. Within 10 minutes of my arrival-my room was ready. Petit Dejeuner was expensive 15 euros-but it is Paris, after all. Buses nearbly that go to Gare de L'Est. I dicovered that you cannot change dollars to euros at banks in France.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice helpful staff but the hotel could be much improved”
Reviews.Author: Earl_of_Doncaster
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night only, chose the hotel as they told me they had secure car parking facilities, and the web price of 110 EUROS was not excessive by Paris standards. BUT: The car park is some distance away in the basement of a seperate building, the spaces were tiny. if your car is any bigger than a Fiat 500 then you might have difficulty. to get in and out of this car park is another puzzle, you need to borrow a card from the Hotel, but you have to take this back there afterwards, there is nowhere to park outside the hotel so we caused trafic chaos whilst returning this card to the reception. The breakfast at 14 EUROS is poor, there a plenty of cafes nearby accross the railway bridge, I would reccoment going there for breakfast, as 14 EUR is a disgrace for a coffee and a croissant. The staff were very helpful and couldn't be faulted. the room was small but comfortable. the one amusing thing was that some previous guest had drunk all the spirits in the minibar and refilled the bottles with water. . . . I If you can get this hotel for a good price it is fine, you can walk to the centre of paris in 20 minutes or take a train from opposite the hotel. Nearby Place de Clichy has plenty of restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “OK as a base for sightseeing in Paris”
Reviews.Author: SunnySurreyTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on business for 2 nights as it was the only one available at very short notice - a distance from my office but right next to a very good train line that is one stop from the centre of Paris. Trains every few minutes. Hotel very basic in style in the public area. No restaurant (except for a breakfast room) but there are plenty of places nearby. Room was fairly small but very clean. Total lack of spare power sockets meant dismantling the bedside lamps to plug in my laptop etc. Very annoying. Would not choose to stay here again myself , but as a base for a trip to Paris it would be fine if a good rate could be obtained.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Opera Batignolles
HotelInfo.Address: 165 Rue de Rome | 17 Arr., 75017 Paris, France
